snippet: Peter Sagan of Slovakia became the youngest winner of a Tour stage since Lance Armstrong took one as a 21-year-old in 1993.
abstract: Peter Sagan of Slovakia wins the first stage of the Tour de France, becoming, at 22 years old, the youngest cyclist to win a Tour stage since Lance Armstrong took one as a 21-year-old in 1993.
lead_paragraph: Peter Sagan of Slovakia became the youngest winner of a Tour stage since Lance Armstrong took one as a 21-year-old in 1993.

headline.seo: Sagan, 22, Is Youngest to Win Tour Stage Since 1993
headline.main: In First Tour, and on First Try, Slovak Wins Stage
headline.print_headline: In His First Tour, Slovak Continues His Rapid Rise
